items.content:
You would like to find the answer to the following question:

"How can you improve the spread of tourists in Amsterdam?"

To answer this question, you need to search for information.
In the video below, you will see how to start your search and how you decide whether it would first be useful to explore a subject.

prompt.body: For a project assignment, you have to search for literature on the most important tourist attractions in Amsterdam. Where do you start?

content.body: You clarify your assignment

Your assignment first needs to be clear. You need to know what the objective is, which requirements apply, how much time you have, and what result is expected. Only when your assignment is clear do you start your search.
You look up all the tourist attractions in Amsterdam

Your assignment first needs to be clear. You need to know what the objective is, which requirements apply, how much time you have, and what result is expected. Only when your assignment is clear do you start your search.
You look for general information about the tourist industry

Your assignment first needs to be clear. You need to know what the objective is, which requirements apply, how much time you have, and what result is expected. Only when your assignment is clear do you start your search.
You think up useful words that you can use for your search

Your assignment first needs to be clear. You need to know what the objective is, what requirements apply, how much time you have, and what result is expected. Only when your assignment is clear do you start your search.

items.content:
You saw in the video that you always start by clarifying your assignment. Then, you determine how complex your question is.

Simple question:

  • can be answered completely by starting to search straight away
  • it is not necessary to answer other questions first
  • exploring the subject is (usually) not necessary

Complex question:

  • cannot be (completely) answered by starting to search straight away
  • it is necessary to answer a few other questions first
  • exploring the subject is necessary.

prompt.body: Which question is an example of a complex question where you will first have to explore the subject?

content.body: How many tourists visit Amsterdam every year?

This is an example of a relatively simple factual question. You can find the information straight away by searching appropriate resources using "tourism" combined with "Amsterdam".

The question, "What impact does the North South Line have on the growth of tourism in Amsterdam?" is a complex question. This question cannot be answered completely by starting to search straight away. You will first have to answer other questions, such as: What is the current rate of growth in tourism in Amsterdam? What aspects of tourism in Amsterdam are affected by the North South Line?, etc.
Where are the greatest traffic bottlenecks on King's Day in Amsterdam?

This is an example of a relatively simple question. You can find the information straight away by searching appropriate resources using "tourism" combined with "Amsterdam".

The question, "What impact does the North South Line have on the growth of tourism in Amsterdam?" is a complex question. This question cannot be answered completely by starting to search straight away. You will first have to answer other questions, such as: What is the current rate of growth in tourism in Amsterdam? What aspects of tourism in Amsterdam are affected by the North South Line?, etc.
What impact does the North South Line have on the growth of tourism in Amsterdam?

This question cannot be answered completely by starting to search straight away. You will first have to answer other questions, such as: What is the current rate of growth in tourism in Amsterdam? What aspects of tourism in Amsterdam are affected by the North South Line?, etc.
How much has the delay in building the North South Line cost the city of Amsterdam?

This is an example of a relatively simple factual question. You can find the information fairly easily by searching appropriate resources using "delay", "North South Line", "Amsterdam", and "costs". It is not necessary to ask other questions first before solving this.

The question, "What impact does the North South Line have on the growth of tourism in Amsterdam?" is a complex question. This question cannot be answered completely by starting to search straight away. You will first have to answer other questions, such as: What is the current rate of growth in tourism in Amsterdam? What aspects of tourism in Amsterdam are affected by the North South Line?, etc.

prompt.body:
When exploring your subject, it is important where you search, as some resources are more useful than others. This will be made clear in the following exercise.

(Select all correct answers)

content.body: Encyclopaedias

Answers A, B, C and E are correct
A: Encyclopaedias often give general information about various subjects. This will give you a general idea of your subject.
B: Newspaper articles contain information about recent developments and events. To gain an up-to-date idea of your subject, this would be a good choice.
D: Articles in academic or scientific journals can be used if you wish to explore a subject in greater depth.
E: Google is suitable for quickly collecting general information about your subject.
Newspaper articles

Answers A, B, C and E are correct
A: Encyclopaedias often give general information about various subjects. This will give you a general idea of your subject.
B: Newspaper articles contain information about recent developments and events. To gain an up-to-date idea of your subject, this would be a good choice.
D: Articles in academic or scientific journals can be used if you wish to explore a subject in greater depth.
E: Google is suitable for quickly collecting general information about your subject.
Textbooks

Answers A, B, C and E are correct
A: Encyclopaedias often give general information about various subjects. This will give you a general idea of your subject.
B: Newspaper articles contain information about recent developments and events. To gain an up-to-date idea of your subject, this would be a good choice.
D: Articles in academic or scientific journals can be used if you wish to explore a subject in greater depth.
E: Google is suitable for quickly collecting general information about your subject.
Articles in academic or scientific journals

Answers A, B, C and E are correct

A: Een encyclopedie geeft vaak algemene informatie over diverse onderwerpen. Je krijgt daarmee een algemeen beeld van je onderwerp.
A: Encyclopaedias often give general information about various subjects. This will give you a general idea of your subject.
B: Newspaper articles contain information about recent developments and events. To gain an up-to-date idea of your subject, this would be a good choice.
D: Articles in academic or scientific journals can be used if you wish to explore a subject in greater depth.
E: Google is suitable for quickly collecting general information about your subject.
Google

Answers A, B, C and E are correct
A: Encyclopaedias often give general information about various subjects. This will give you a general idea of your subject.
B: Newspaper articles contain information about recent developments and events. To gain an up-to-date idea of your subject, this would be a good choice.
D: Articles in academic or scientific journals can be used if you wish to explore a subject in greater depth.
E: Google is suitable for quickly collecting general information about your subject.

items.content:
In this module you have learned:

  • that it is important to first clarify your assignment
  • that, in case of a complex question, it is important to first explore your subject

You can use the search logbook to keep a record of how you have conducted searches during your own project. This is useful and saves time, although it is not a compulsory part of the course, unless your degree programme has stated otherwise. Note down what you have done after every module;

Now note down your hypothesis, your research question and sub-questions in your logbook.
